title: FPS drops, ping is fine
body: A long time ago, I found a fix for disabling Search UI.exe and Skypehost through the command prompt. I never restarted my computer after that, but a wondows 10 update came through and forced a restart, Since then, both Search UI and Skypehost are back up and running. I have disabled them through the task manager to no avail. This eats my CPU usage and causes my FPS to drop to 1-10 fps, instead of my normal around 60. My ping is fine, and I have replicated this issue at another house to make sure it wasn't just my internet. I cannot find the article with the command prompts anymore, and was wiondering if anyone knew how to solve this issue or permanently close these programs so I can play again?

replies.body: Having the same issue! Last time this happened it just randomly went away someday with no solution, so I have no clue what to do D:!

I was able to find two separate guides for disabling these applications. [**Here**](http://www.howtogeek.com/265027/how-to-disable-cortana-in-windows-10/) is the one to disable SearchUI.exe (Cortana) and [**here**](http://www.howtogeek.com/74523/how-to-disable-startup-programs-in-windows/) is the one to disable Skype and any related services from starting up with your computer.

Let me know if this did the trick!
